question.text: For a chemical reaction <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></math> <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mrow><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi></msub><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Θ</mi></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>80</mn><mo> </mo><mi>kJ</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi>mol</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfenced></math> the entropy change <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi></msub><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Θ</mi></msup></math> depends on the temperature <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></math> (in <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></math>) as <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi></msub><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Θ</mi></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>JK</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mi>mol</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfenced></math>. Minimum temperature at which it will become spontaneous is <u>                </u> <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></math>. (Integer)

data.bucket: Must Do Ques (JEE Main) - Any Difficulty
